```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
```

```{r}
d<-read.csv("TrainingData/TrainingData.csv",header=F)
```

# Number of classes
```{r}
length(unique(d$V2))
```

# How many images of each class

```{r}
sort(table(d$V2))
```

```{r}
write.table(sort(unique(d$V2)),"cloudML/dict.txt",sep="\n",quote=F)
```

We are looking for about 200 images per class.

# Split into 80 20 data
```{r}
tn=nrow(d)
testing<-sample(1:tn,tn*.2)
test_data<-d[1:nrow(d) %in% testing,]
train_data<-d[!1:nrow(d) %in% testing,]
write.table(test_data,"cloudML/testing_data.csv",row.names=F,col.names = F,sep=",")
write.table(train_data,"cloudML/training_data.csv",col.names=F,row.names=F,sep=",")

```
